choices.label: Photosynthesis converts light energy into chemical energy

feedback.value: Correct! Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert sunlight into glucose.

choices.rationale: Photosynthesis is performed by plants, algae, and some bacteria. It uses light energy to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose and oxygen.

choices.label: Mitochondria are found only in plant cells

feedback.value: Incorrect. Mitochondria are found in both plant and animal cells.

choices.rationale: Mitochondria are the "powerhouses" of the cell and are present in nearly all eukaryotic cells, including both plants and animals.

choices.label: Cellular respiration breaks down glucose to produce ATP

feedback.value: Correct! Cellular respiration is how cells extract energy from glucose.

choices.rationale: Cellular respiration occurs in the mitochondria and converts glucose and oxygen into ATP (energy), carbon dioxide, and water. This is essentially the reverse of photosynthesis.

choices.label: Chloroplasts are the site of cellular respiration

feedback.value: Incorrect. Chloroplasts are where photosynthesis occurs, not cellular respiration.

choices.rationale: Chloroplasts contain chlorophyll and are responsible for photosynthesis in plant cells. Cellular respiration takes place in the mitochondria.
